ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Consolidated some knowledge form L1 and L2, can speak and write better as a result
The course was effective because it provided a good review of Italian grammar while also introducing new vocabulary and new information through longer readings.

I found my Italian skills to improve immensely. I got a great grasp on grammar and expanded my vocabulary. I was able to speak much better than when I started the class, but I still wish I had more speaking practice.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Its weaknesses would be unnecessary things like the countless workbook exercises from which I feel like I learn nothing.

This course is very organized in the sense that every single day is planned. I think that this is both a strength and a weakness. While a rigid structure keeps the class on schedule, it doesn't allow extra time for topics that are more difficult for the class.

The course is a pretty standard language course which uses a good textbook. The class meets every day, which is helpful for a language. Could be improved with more situational dialogue practice, for ex: what to do when ordering at a restaurant, casual conversation with strangers, etc.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I mean, you would need to take L1 and L2 beforehand or place into this class. But it is a good class to reinforce the things that you would have studied in Elementary Italian. Not too much work, but class everyday wears on you of course. Italian's a good language for anyone to complete their language requirement.
Sure, it is not much different from L1 and L2 anyway
I think that if you are interested in Italian it is a good class to take!
Yes, it is a necessary building block to progressing in the study of Italian, a beautiful language.
